thread.title: Matt Harvey set for Game 1 with shackles off completely
thread.title_full: Matt Harvey set for Game 1 with shackles off completely | New York Post

author: Joel Sherman
title: Matt Harvey set for Game 1 with shackles off completely
text:
LOS ANGELES — Matt Harvey tried to talk Terry Collins into using him in short relief if necessary in the decisive Division Series contest. The Mets manager instead was saving him to pitch in case Game 5 went to extra innings, and now he is the NLCS Game 1 starter.
Remember when he had innings limits?
Because Collins had Noah Syndergaard warm up four times and ultimately pitch the seventh inning Thursday night in the Mets’ 3-2 clincher victory over the Dodgers, the righty was removed as the logical option to start NLCS Game 1 against Jon Lester and the Cubs on Saturday.
Collins was leaning strongly toward using Syndergaard in relief Thursday, so already was plotting to start Harvey on regular four days’ rest if the Mets advanced.
Harvey worked five innings and earned the win in Monday’s Game 3. That took him to 194 ¹/₃ innings in a season when his agent, Scott Boras, insisted the righty’s surgeon, Dr. James Andrews, and other prominent doctors believed exceeding 180 innings put Harvey in a danger zone for re-injury.
But Harvey apparently has embraced the idea of pitching regularly for as long as the Mets are in the playoffs, which means at least Game 1 — and theoretically Game 5 — against the Cubs. And then, if the Mets move to the World Series, at least one and possibly two more starts there.
“It’s a huge honor,” Harvey said of getting the NLCS Game 1 nod. “I am very excited about it. I was a little disappointed in my last start, so getting another chance to go back out there and start us off right is everything I want.”
